issue.title: patreon.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://patreon.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpatreon.com) ### Comment Username: @infinitewaveparticle > First of all, in the AdGuard app, I selected "Missed ad or tracker", but when this form was loaded there was no option to select "Missed tracker". Anyway, this report is to let you know that there is a tracker in Patreon emails for when you choose to load remote content (images, etc). The tracking server is shown in the screenshot as blocked because I have manually added it to the user filter. I suggest that you add it to your DNS and regular lists as well. The server is "email.mailgun.patreon.com" and is used to track users who load their emails. Please block it. Blocking it manually has not affected the images loading in the emails. ### Screenshots

Sorry for not responding.

The button is called "Spil og vind" ("Play and win"). It is not always available and it is not available without an account.

I just tried it, and it was not blocked, so did you allow it?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
